summary: Email from Ghislaine Maxwell's attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim to prison officials reporting that Maxwell was physically mistreated and verbally threatened by MDC staff over the weekend of January 2-3, 2021. The attorney details inappropriate touching during a body search and threats of false charges, warning of official complaints if the mistreatment continues.

events.title: Alleged Mistreatment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was allegedly physically mistreated during a body search by an MDC officer who squeezed her breast with "vice-like pressure," and was verbally threatened by another officer with false assault charges.

events.title: Formal Complaint Filed
events.description: Attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim sent a formal email complaint to prison officials detailing the alleged mistreatment of Ghislaine Maxwell by MDC staff over the weekend.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Referenced in the email as a death resulting from BOP negligence, which tarnished the Bureau's reputation and is correlated to Maxwell's restrictive detention conditions.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's attorney alleged she was physically assaulted by an MDC officer who squeezed her breast with "vice-like pressure equivalent to a mammography" during a body search.
Another MDC officer allegedly threatened to falsely charge Maxwell with "assaulting an officer" if she moved during future searches.
The attorney stated this was not the first time Maxwell had been inappropriately touched by MDC staff, according to prison records.
The complaint warned that further mistreatment would result in official complaints to the Attorney General's Office and the Court.
The email explicitly connected Maxwell's restrictive detention conditions to the "Epstein debacle" and the BOP's negligence in Epstein's death.
